sentences.english: This is how the CICM presence in Singapore started.
sentences.chinese: 這是如何開始在新加坡聖母聖心會的存在。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower at sunset from the Sacre-Coeur Basilica.
sentences.chinese: 在聖心大教堂上欣賞暮色中的埃菲爾鐵塔。

sentences.english: Many of the most severely injured patients had been transported to Sacre Coeur.
sentences.chinese: 受傷最爲嚴重的許多病人已被轉至聖心醫院治療。

sentences.english: At Sheng Xin, we sometimes used the shuttlelecock to play adifferent game.
sentences.chinese: 在聖心，我們通常會用毽子來玩不同的遊戲。

sentences.english: But this fact does not diminish the love for China of the CICM missionaries.
sentences.chinese: 但這一事實並不會削弱中國的聖母聖心會傳教士的愛。

sentences.english: In fact, researches at Sacred Heart University devoted an entire study to this phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，聖心大學曾經專門研究過這種現象。

sentences.english: The Sacred Heart Catholic church (Basilique Sacré-Coeur) is seen on Paris' highest point, in Montmartre.
sentences.chinese: 蒙馬特區的聖心殿是不雅鑑賞巴黎全景的最高點。

sentences.english: Basllique du Sacre Coeur was the last stop in the first day.
sentences.chinese: 聖心教堂是我們第一天的最後一站。

definition: Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
archaic variant of 蘇|苏[su1]/to revive
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
